name: Old Loggers Path
comment: I have trail map. Ben Barbash says, "yellow dog/Rock run campsite is an all time great...There are also two shelters on the trail which make for some easy nights while out there" Also, Brad Street says, "if you're arriving on an afternoon hike counter clockwise, to camp near rock run first night. If arriving in morning, hike clockwise. Camp near rock run second night. Assuming that you are parking at Maston parking area and hiking 2 and 1/2 days. 2 "long" days (around 10 miles) and 1 shorter"

name: Loyalsock
blaze: yellow with either red LT or old ones with red line

name: Switchback Railroad
comment: Trail end points: E. Holland at Amidon St. (Summit Hill) and North Ave. nr. Pine Ave. and Center Ave. nr. Packer Hill Rd. (Jim Thorpe)

name: Stony Valley Rail-Trail
comment:
Links to gameland maps with trail on them are towards bottom of page. 
Saint Anthony's Wilderness in along this trail.

name: Wissahickon-Yellow
comment: Longest Trail in Wissahickon Park, it goes from Lincoln Drive to Bell's Mill Rd on the Roxborough side of the creek.

name: Tracy Ridge Hiking
comment: Not as scenic as Morrison Trail

name: Morrison Hiking Trail
comment: Nicer than Tracy Ridge

name: Lehigh Gorge
comment: It is part of the Delaware & Lehigh Trail (id = 6).

name: Yellow Springs Loop Trail
comment: It will lead you to the ruins of the former Yellow Springs Village as well as an old excavator. You'll know you've arrived at the abandoned village when you see the sign announcing "Yellow Springs - Old Coal Mining Village." State Game Lands #211

name: Susquehannock Trail System
comment: It in the Susquehannock State Forest in Potter and Clinton counties in north-central Pennsylvania in the United States.

name: Horseshoe Trail
comment: Starts at Valley Forge National Park and ends at Appalachian Trail.

name: Valley Creek Trail
comment: Zack liked this trail when his was little. This is where he sang the mushy mushroom song capture on video.

name: Sunset Rocks Trail
comment: Trail will lead you to the spectacular ruins of a POW camp during World War II.

name: Tumbling Waters Trail
comment: Trail will take you past spectacular scenery, including ruins, ponds, a waterfall, and a pine forest.

name: Elk Trail
comment: Start this 16-mile backpack from the trailhead on PA 555 and tackle some of the countryâ€™s newest elk habitat. Go in October for bugling.

name: Quehanna Trail
comment: Map is split into east and west sections, so the map URL goes to a map listing.

name: Pennypack Trail -
comment: Philly part of this trail in Pennypack park from Delaware River to Montco section.

name: Green Ribbon Trail
comment: Google maps are broken into north and south; see main url for links to both.

name: Thousand Steps
comment: Steep climb at 3.5 hrs out.

name: Conestoga Trail
comment: Backpacking FB advice: park at pequea or southern pinnacle

name: West Rim Trail
comment: Map in 2 parts, and this is southern: < http://www.docs.dcnr.pa.gov/cs/groups/public/documents/document/dcnr_002046.pdf >/ Some sites say it is  26.5 miles in length.

name: Pine Creek Trail
comment: The DCNR maps for West Rim Trail also include a portion of this trail.

name: Mason-Dixon Trail
comment: GPS coordinates: 39.53899, -75.6673

name: Conewago Recreation Trail
comment: A Rail Trail.

name: Rausch Gap Loop
comment: 2 hours from home, 100 miles.

name: AT-Old Horse-Shoe Trail Loop
comment: 2 hours from home, 100 miles

name: Barbour Rock Trail
comment: The best, easily-accessible spot from which to view the PA Grand Canyon is on the Barbour Rock Trail. NOTE: Need to link to Colton Point State Park when that park is entered into the database.

name: Hawk Rock via Appalachian Trail
comment: In a recommendation for trails near Harrisburg.

name: Mount Minsi via Appalachian Trail
comment: Sttep and rocky, but results in a great view.

name: Golden Eagle Trail
comment: On FB hiking group discussion, someone state it was the best day hike in PA.

name: Pinchot Trail System
comment: New maps, because parts were rerouted. For some details: https://endlessmountains.wordpress.com/2017/10/26/hiking-the-new-re-routes-of-the-pinchot-trail-south-loop/ . Also, here: https://www.facebook.com/165829503626553/photos/a.671747366368095/934606313415531/?type=3&theater
